Params: {3: "They say the snow in the ARU never melts. The land's cold, hard, and barren, like it was never meant for people."}
{3: 'The whining cold winds always carry a touch of melancholy, like the people who call this place home.'}
{3: 'A harsh environment, scarce food, limited sunlight... even the literature born here is steeped in sorrow.'}
{3: 'Yet, despite the sorrow, the writing on this permafrost is always about the soul, and the soul remains intensely passionate.'}
{3: "What moves between the ports isn't just the icebreakers that conquered the Arctic Ocean, but also the spirits and lives of these people."}
{3: 'Now, this frozen land shelters the last humans on Earth.'}
{3: 'The campfire looks tiny under the stars, but it keeps the darkness away for everyone.'}
{3: 'The next winter is coming, and the future is unclear, but those worries can wait around this campfire.'}
{3: 'The wandering singer carefully unwraps her guitar, handling it like a newborn—new guitar strings are impossible to find.'}
{3: 'She readies her guitar and clears her throat, and as sparks fly from the fire, her song starts to drift through the camp.'}
{2: 'Wandering Singer', 3: '{226|153|170}We walk through the dust of golden years...{226|153|170}'}
{3: 'She walks through the crowd and sits by the fire. Pulling down her hood, she listens to the song.'}
{3: 'In her daze, she sees a figure in the bonfire—the younger, more innocent <phonetic=self>figure</phonetic> of hers.'}
{3: 'The flames stop flickering without a sound.'}
{3: 'Everything around her freezes, like a picture on a page.'}
{3: 'Ishmael raises her hand and gently flips it as if turning a page.'}
{3: 'The flames, the song, and even the distant stars are all pulled away.'}
{3: 'Time becomes a book, its pages turning backward—'}
{3: 'What happens here might be the work of what some call "gods"—a realm beyond humanity\'s reach.'}
{3: 'Or maybe the pages never existed, and it is just Ishmael remembering a past that is out of reach.'}
{3: "Dazed and disoriented like waking from a dream, Ishmael hears not the singer's song but a familiar voice from her memories."}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: "What's up? It's way past dinner, and you're still tucked away reading?", 18: '100006223'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: 'Ayi and everyone are looking for you, I heard.', 18: '100006224'}
{3: "Ishmael pulls up a virtual panel and finds her friends' messages flooding the screen non-stop, their portraits on fire."}
{3: 'Recording a sincere apology with the virtual panel, Ishmael sends the video to her friends.'}
{3: 'After comforting her friend, Ishmael turns to her professor, who has already picked up her book.'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: 'Enjoying a real book, I see. Just my style.', 18: '100006226'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Like they say, a student follows their teacher's example.", 18: '100006227'}
{3: 'Raheleh gently turns the pages of the book.'}
{3: '"This inequality shows that the heat flowing into the system and its..."'}
{3: '"Subsequent scholars consistently introduced new hypotheses to the original theory..."'}
{3: '"Therefore, it can be proven that this principle and..."'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: 'Sigh... Do you really have to read such heavy books even in your free time? Besides, you know all this, right?', 18: '100006228'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "I'm just reading it for fun, that's all.", 18: '100006229'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: "You take things too seriously. I'd love to see you loosen up a bit.", 18: '100006230'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: 'You should be doing things young people usually do.', 18: '100006231'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: 'Let me take a look at this version...', 18: '100006232'}
{3: "She taps Ishmael's book twice, and the text starts to shift and change rapidly, coming to life as if by some enchantment."}
{3: 'Raheleh closes the book, and it is now titled "The Legend of the Gray Star".'}
{3: 'She hands the book back to Ishmael.'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: "It's good to read some fiction now and then.", 18: '100006234'}
{3: 'As her professor turns to leave, Ishmael stands up and calls out to her after a brief hesitation.'}
{3: 'Raheleh turns back, and her student looks worried.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Are you sure about that experiment? I've been feeling... uneasy lately...", 18: '100006240'}
{3: 'Raheleh steps forward, smiling at the child who she sees as a daughter.'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: "Don't worry. It's an honor, and it's what I want.", 18: '100006241'}
{3: 'Raheleh suddenly tilts her head, like she just thought of something.'}
{2: 'Raheleh', 3: 'Want to grab dinner? I know a popular new restaurant on another planet. They have a great set meal for two, perfect for us.', 18: '100006242'}
{3: "Seeing her professor as calm as ever, Ishmael's worries disappear."}
{3: 'The smile freezes as a gust of wind blows from afar.'}
{3: 'Then the entire memory turns like a page in a book.'}
{3: 'The static from the tropospheric flight fills the transport, gently lulling everyone to sleep.'}
{3: 'Until a sudden jolt of turbulence awakes everyone.'}
{3: 'Meanwhile, Lucia is already on high alert next to you.'}
{2: 'Comms Channel', 3: "This is the pilot speaking. We're experiencing some turbulence.", 18: '100006244'}
{2: 'Comms Channel', 3: "It's going to be pretty rough for a little bit, but it'll pass soon.", 18: '100006245'}
{3: 'The turbulence has woken you up too.'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Don't you want to rest a bit more?", 4: '1', 18: '100006247'}
{3: 'You stretch a little. Even though your injuries are mostly healed, Professor Hippocrates still wants you to rest.'}
{2: "She'd give me an earful if she knew I was on a mission.", 3: '362'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Even though I don't really think you should be on missions yet, Commandant...", 4: '1', 18: '100006248'}
{2: "I've had quite a bit of rest.", 3: '365'}
{3: 'After the Empyrea incident, Gray Raven has started taking on simpler missions, and this is one of them.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Liv has been getting regular check-ups at the Star of Life for her M.I.N.D. issues, so she has not been on recent missions.'}
{3: 'You take a deep breath and focus. Right now, you need to concentrate on the mission.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'A pink-haired woman watches you with a soft smile.'}
{3: 'She seems to have been waiting for your question.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Long time no see, Gray Raven... Commandant. I'm Ishmael from the Control Court.", 4: '1', 18: '100006249'}
{2: 'Excuse me... Have we met before?', 3: '390', 4: "(It's been a while?)", 5: '391'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'This is the first time "you" and I are meeting.', 4: '1', 18: '100006250'}
{2: "This is our first meeting, isn't it?", 3: '392'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'This is the first time "you" and I are meeting.', 4: '1', 18: '100006251'}
{3: '"A strange yet gentle senior"—that is your first impression of Ishmael.'}
{2: 'Are you the Control Court agent here to help with this mission?', 3: '399'}
{3: 'The briefing did say a Control Court agent would be joining you.'}
{2: "Let's go over the mission details, then.", 3: '403'}
{3: 'According to the briefing, you are going to an underground facility left behind after the Punishing Virus outbreak, built by the old World Government.'}
{3: 'Later, surface dwellers found this underground space and turned it into a base not unlike a conservation area, which now houses thousands.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: '"Four days ago, Hutu, their leader, contacted Babylonia for help."', 4: '1', 18: '100006254'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: '"Hutu said the Punishing Virus concentration outside the base has been rising for weeks."', 4: '1', 18: '100006255'}
{3: 'You have pretty much the same intel.'}
{2: 'Records show only Corrupted were seen around the base before.', 3: '422'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'Are they moving to another conservation area?', 4: '1', 18: '100006258'}
{2: '【kuroname】', 3: "Hutu, their leader, has determined that the place is no longer livable. If the Punishing Virus concentration gets too high, they'll be trapped inside and die."}
{2: 'So they want to move to a Babylonia-controlled conservation area.', 3: '429'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "The briefing's on your terminal, but I'm guessing you're not here just to review it, are you, 【kuroname】?", 4: '1', 18: '100006259'}
{3: 'The pink-haired woman gives you a knowing look.'}
{2: 'This is a standard mission, so why...', 3: '435'}
{2: '...Why is a Control Court member joining the Task Force?', 3: '436'}
{3: 'She is not really joining you, technically. The briefing makes it sound like she is just coming along for the ride.'}
{3: 'Plus, there is the line that says you are "not responsible for the safety of the accompanying Control Court member".'}
{3: 'The Control Court usually stays in the shadows, so it is rare for them to go to the surface. They do not typically show interest in the earthbound factions.'}
{3: 'Given their role, could this mission involve the World Government? Is it about something on the surface... remnants of the Golden Age?'}
{3: 'Even though you are both from Babylonia, you are the commandant here. You need to know her real intentions.'}
{3: 'After pondering briefly, the pink-haired woman smiles enigmatically.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'You ever heard of something called the "Dark Rooms"?', 4: '1', 18: '100006261'}
{3: 'Ishmael is surprisingly open, her voice soft as she shares secrets of the past.'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: '"Dark Rooms" are a few secret facilities built after the World Government was formed. There aren\'t many, and each has a slightly different purpose.', 4: '1', 18: '100006262'}
{2: 'The "Dark Rooms"... Do they belong to the Science Council?', 3: '450'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Back then, even though the Science Council was supposed to operate under the World Government, they didn't just blindly follow orders.", 4: '1', 18: '100006265'}
{2: 'And so, the "Dark Rooms" were created out of necessity.', 3: '455'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'The World Government needed research facilities that would follow orders without question.', 4: '1', 18: '100006267'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Even if the research there doesn't seem groundbreaking now, the Control Court has to inspect and retrieve the materials.", 4: '1', 18: '100006268'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Exactly. Hutu's contact with Babylonia led to the discovery of this Dark Room. So, the Control Court needs to recover the data stored there.", 4: '1', 18: '100006269'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Don't worry too much. I get your concerns. The Control Court isn't...", 4: '1', 18: '100006271'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "I don't have any hidden agendas. I'll follow your orders on this mission.", 4: '1', 18: '100006272'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'You don\'t need to worry about where I am. I\'ll finish my "mission" before we leave and won\'t get in your way.', 4: '1', 18: '100006273'}
{3: 'That enigmatic smile remains on her face.'}
{3: 'Maybe it is just you, but you feel something "amusing" behind her smile.'}
{2: 'Comms Channel', 3: "This is the pilot. We'll arrive in ten minutes.", 18: '100006274'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Commandant, we've got Lee back on comms.", 4: '1', 18: '100006275'}
{3: 'His signal range has been greatly reduced since the location is underground, so you are only now connecting with Lee.'}
{1: '1', 3: "When you open your terminal to talk to Lee, the signal is surprisingly choppy, making Lee's image blurry."}
{3: 'Then, you hear the sound of Lee firing before the comms cut out.'}
